Source: NHS Pay and Conditions Circular (M&D) 2/2025; nhsemployers.org
Notes: FY1 single nodal point — no range within grade. 2025-26 rate (from 1 April 2025). Excludes supplements: night enhancements (37%), weekend allowances, on-call payments which can add ~10-20% on top.

Source: NHS Pay and Conditions Circular (M&D) 2/2025; nhsemployers.org
Notes: FY2 single nodal point — no range within grade. 2025-26 rate (from 1 April 2025). Excludes supplements — see FY1 note. Represents approx 22% increase from pre-2024 deal levels.

Source: BMA pay scales for resident doctors in England 2025-26; NHS Pay and Conditions Circular (M&D) 2/2025; nhsemployers.org
Notes: Min=Nodal Point 3 (CT1/CT2/ST1-ST2) £52,656; Typical=Nodal Point 4 (CT3/ST3-ST5) £65,048; Max=Nodal Point 5 (ST6-ST8) £73,992. 2025-26 rates from the 2016 contract for resident doctors in England, confirmed by BMA. Note: GOV.UK 'going rates' for immigration purposes differ (CT1 going rate £49,909; CT3+ going rate £61,825) — these are used for Skilled Worker visa salary thresholds but do not reflect actual contract pay. Excludes supplements (night enhancements, weekend allowances, on-call payments) and Clinical Excellence Awards.

Source: NHS Pay Award 2025-26 (gov.uk); BMA pay scales for consultants in England; Nuffield Trust 2025
Notes: Min=Threshold 1 entry point (Year 0); Typical=approx midpoint between Threshold 2b (£119,490 at 4 years) and Threshold 3 (£131,058 at 8 years); Max=Threshold 4 (£145,478 at 14 years — top of scale). 2025-26 rates (4% pay award). The consultant contract was reformed from 1 March 2024, reducing from 8 thresholds to 4 (with sub-thresholds 2a/2b) and reducing years to top from 19 to 14. Average total earnings including supplements/CEA reported at ~£161,600 (Nuffield Trust 2025).

Source: Market research; BMA Private Practice Survey; locum agency rates
Notes: ESTIMATED. Private sector registrar roles are uncommon as a primary employment — most registrars are NHS-employed and do occasional private/locum work. Range reflects full-time private equivalent. Highly specialty-dependent. Min=low-volume private/locum; Typical=active private practice; Max=high-demand surgical specialty. Verify against current locum agency listings.

Source: BMA Private Practice Survey 2024; IMG Connect 2025; market research
Notes: ESTIMATED. Most UK consultants work a hybrid NHS+private model. Pure private practice range is extremely wide by specialty (GP vs. cardiac surgeon). Typical reflects a mid-career consultant with established NHS role supplemented by regular private sessions. Max refers to top surgical/procedural specialties with high patient volumes. This figure requires manual verification against BMA Private Practice Survey.
